weeklyVerdict: Growth is real but fragile — organic is carrying paid's underperformance this week. Meta CPL crept up 18% to $33 while email list grew by 94 subscribers, the best week in six weeks. The VSL on the DTMCN page needs immediate attention: finish rate dropped to 31%, which directly explains why conversion fell despite traffic holding steady.

awareness.summary: YouTube up 22% WoW, organic search holding steady with 3 queries breaking into top-5 positions.

consideration.summary: Sessions flat, but time-on-site dropped 14% — visitors are landing and leaving faster than last week.

conversion.summary: DTMCN landing page conversion fell to 2.1% from 3.4% — VSL finish rate collapse is the likely cause.

retention.summary: Best email open rate in 6 weeks (41.2%), list grew 94 this week — nurture is working.

urgentActions.action: Audit the DTMCN VSL for drop-off at the 47-second mark
urgentActions.why: Vimeo data shows 68% of viewers drop at 0:47. This is the exact moment the pricing section begins. Conversion on that page fell from 3.4% to 2.1% in the same week.
urgentActions.howTo: Open Vimeo → Video → Analytics → Engagement graph. Identify what's on screen at 0:47. Likely a price reveal without enough value buildup before it.
urgentActions.expectedOutcome: If you add a 15-second value recap before the price, industry benchmarks suggest 20-30% finish rate improvement — which should push conversion back above 3%.

urgentActions.action: Pause the cold Awareness campaign on Meta and reallocate budget to Retargeting
urgentActions.why: Awareness CPL hit $47 vs $28 target — third consecutive week of decline. Retargeting CPL is $19 and improving. You're paying 2.5x more to reach cold audiences who aren't converting.
urgentActions.howTo: Meta Ads Manager → Campaigns → 'DTM Awareness - Cold' → Deactivate. Then increase Retargeting daily budget by $85/day (the saved amount).
urgentActions.expectedOutcome: Redirects ~$595/week to retargeting where CPL is $19. Should generate ~31 additional leads at same spend.

urgentActions.action: Turn the Tuesday VSL email subject line into a Meta ad headline test
urgentActions.why: That email hit 41.2% open rate — 2x your average. The subject 'Stop guessing what your clients need' resonated. Same pain-point framing should work as ad copy.
urgentActions.howTo: In Meta Ads Manager, duplicate your top-performing ad. Replace headline with: 'Stop guessing what your clients need.' A/B test for 7 days, $20/day budget.
urgentActions.expectedOutcome: If open rate uplift transfers, expect CTR improvement of 0.3-0.8% — could reduce CPL by $5-8.

urgentActions.action: Create content around 'marketing system for consultants' — you're on page 2, it's high-intent
urgentActions.why: GSC shows this query at position 14 with 340 impressions but only 8 clicks (2.4% CTR). You're one strong post away from page 1.
urgentActions.howTo: Write a pillar post targeting 'marketing system for consultants'. Use the exact phrase in H1, URL slug, and first 100 words. Internal link from 3 existing posts.
urgentActions.expectedOutcome: Breaking into top 5 positions typically yields 5-10x CTR improvement. At 340 impressions, that's 85-170 additional organic visits/month.

insights.observation: YouTube video 'How to Build a Marketing System' drove a 34% traffic spike to /marketing-system/ on Thursday
insights.meaning: Your YouTube audience is actively searching for implementation resources after watching. They're warm leads by the time they hit your site.
insights.hypothesis: The video's CTA directed viewers to the URL. Combined with the video's strong retention (71% finish rate), viewers arrived with high intent.
insights.recommendation: Add a content upgrade to /marketing-system/ — a downloadable template or checklist. Capture those warm visitors as subscribers.

insights.observation: Tuesday broadcast hit 41.2% open rate and 6.8% CTR — both 2x your 4-broadcast average
insights.meaning: The pain-point subject line ('Stop guessing what your clients need') dramatically outperformed your usual benefit-led subjects.
insights.hypothesis: Pain-point framing creates urgency. Benefit-framing tells people what they get. Pain-framing tells them what they're currently suffering — and suffering drives opens.
insights.recommendation: Test pain-point subjects in next 2 broadcasts. Track whether open rate holds or this was novelty.

insights.observation: DTMCN VSL finish rate dropped from 58% to 31% this week
insights.meaning: Less than a third of viewers are seeing your offer. You're essentially wasting ad spend — people are arriving, starting the video, and leaving before they know what you're selling.
insights.hypothesis: The 47-second drop-off point aligns with the pricing reveal. The video likely jumps to price before building sufficient value. Viewers are self-selecting out at sticker shock.
insights.recommendation: Add a 'here's what you get' section before the price reveal. Testimonials or case studies between the pitch and the pricing tend to anchor value effectively.

insights.observation: 3 queries broke into top-5 positions this week: 'small business marketing consultant', 'marketing strategy for small business', 'how to get marketing clients'
insights.meaning: These are high-intent, commercially relevant queries. You're now visible to people actively looking for your services.
insights.hypothesis: The content refresh on /blog/marketing-consultant-tips/ from 3 weeks ago has indexed and gained authority.
insights.recommendation: Update the page's CTA to be more conversion-focused now that it's getting clicks. Add a lead magnet or booking link above the fold.

insights.observation: Retargeting campaign CPL dropped to $19 — down from $24 last week and $31 four weeks ago
insights.meaning: Your retargeting is in a positive improvement trend. This is rare — most campaigns plateau. Something in the creative or audience is working.
insights.hypothesis: The audience list has been refining itself over time. You're now retargeting a higher-quality pool of previous visitors.
insights.recommendation: Do not change anything in this campaign. Increase budget instead — this is a proven vehicle at a good price.

insights.observation: Average view duration increased to 4:12 from 3:08 last week across all videos
insights.meaning: Viewers are staying longer. This signals YouTube's algorithm to push your content to more people.
insights.hypothesis: The new intro format (problem statement in first 15 seconds) is reducing early abandonment.
insights.recommendation: Keep the new intro format. Consider applying it retroactively in the description/thumbnail of older videos to improve browse discovery.

insights.observation: Variant B on the consultant landing page is converting at 5.2% vs Variant A's 3.1% — 67% lift
insights.meaning: The headline change ('Get Clients Systematically' vs 'Join the Network') is making a significant difference. Variant B frames the outcome, not the action.
insights.hypothesis: Outcome-focused headlines outperform action-focused ones because they answer 'what's in it for me' immediately.
insights.recommendation: Declare Variant B the winner and make it the control. This is statistically significant at current traffic levels.

doNotTouch.reason: CPL is $19 and dropping week-over-week for 4 straight weeks. This is a positive trend. Any changes to creative, audience, or bidding risk resetting the optimization.
Three of your top 4 open rates in the last 8 broadcasts have been Tuesday sends. Tuesday is clearly when your list is most engaged.
doNotTouch.metric: 41.2% open rate this week, 38.7% last Tuesday send

doNotTouch.reason: 67% conversion lift over Variant A. Declare it winner and set it as control — do not run a new test until you understand why B won.

watchNextWeek.because: This week's spike may be YouTube-driven (single video). Needs to confirm it's a lasting trend before building content strategy around it.
watchNextWeek.threshold: If it stays above 200 sessions/week for 2 consecutive weeks, treat it as a sustained trend and expand the content cluster.

watchNextWeek.because: Ticked up slightly from 0.1% to 0.18% this week. Not alarming yet, but if it hits 0.3% the list health is degrading.
watchNextWeek.threshold: Act if unsubscribe rate exceeds 0.25% in any single broadcast.

watchNextWeek.because: Pausing the campaign today — watch whether total lead volume drops significantly or retargeting absorbs the gap.
watchNextWeek.threshold: If total weekly leads drop below 40 (from current 52), reactivate Awareness at reduced budget.
